intro: Chaetaria mauritiana, commonly known as the Mauritius hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered spikelets that produce tiny flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native region.
